text.p: Shares of shipping and transport firms Diperdana Corporation Bhd and Konsortium Perkapalan Bhd were suspended on Thursday, said an official at the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange.
No reason was given for the suspension, but both suspensions were at the companies' request, said the official.
Officials at both companies could not be immediately reached for comment.
Diperdana shares were last traded at 18.90 ringgit, while Konsortium shares were suspended at 15.30 ringgit.
Both companies are controlled by Mirzan Mahathir, eldest son of Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad.
Diperdana is the shipping arm of Konsortium which is primarily a land-based transport company.

Analysts said the suspension may be a preliminary move for the announcement of the acquisition of a 30 percent stake in Malaysian International Shipping Corporation Bhd currently held by the state-owned Employees Provident Fund (EPF).
An official at MISC said he was unaware of the rumour, and declined to comment on it.
Officials at EPF could not immediately be reached for comment.
